intro: Lophiocarpus guayanensis, commonly known as the Guayana lophiocarpus, is a species of flowering plant native to South America, particularly found in regions of Venezuela and Brazil. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its compound leaves and pod-like fruits. The plant typically grows in moist, tropical environments and is often found in forest understories. Its botanical features include small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters, and it plays a role in nitrogen fixation due to its symbiotic relationship with nitrogen-fixing bacteria.
